content: Created a minimal `outputs/src/requirements.txt` specifying that the entrypoint is standard-library-only, ensuring reproducible runs without third-party dependency drift.

output.code:
from pathlib import Path
import json

target_path = Path('/mnt/data').joinpath('outputs/src/requirements.txt')
target_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

chunks = [
"""# This project intentionally uses only the Python standard library.
# No third-party dependencies are required for deterministic execution."""
]

final_text = '\n'.join(block.strip('\n') for block in chunks).strip() + '\n'
target_path.write_text(final_text, encoding='utf-8')

print('FILE_WRITTEN:outputs/src/requirements.txt')
print('DIR_STATE:' + json.dumps(sorted(str(p.relative_to(Path("/mnt/data"))) for p in target_path.parent.glob('*') if p.is_file())))

content.text: Created a minimal `outputs/src/requirements.txt` specifying that the entrypoint is standard-library-only, ensuring reproducible runs without third-party dependency drift.
